text: UPDATED: APR 19, 2016 Draught from Bryggeri Helsinki. Slight haze, pale gold, 6-8 srm. 2 fingers white head with solid retention. Light floral and pink pepper aromas, as well as light honey on the nose too. Medium body, medium high carbonation and strong bitterness for a pils. Lots of esters for a pilsner. For me it tastes more like an American pale: bitterness is too high and hop profile too. A bit of peppermint, grass, bubblegum/hard pink candy taste. If no consideration of style this is a good beer but don?t expect a pils...

Draught @ [ SOPP 2015 ] @ Railway Square / Rautatientori, Helsinki, Finland. [ As Plevnan Petolintu ].Clear medium orange yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, pale malt, sweet malt. Flavor is moderate sweet and light bitter with a long duration, sweet malt, pale malt. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20150723]

Keg at SOPP, Helsinki.  Clear deep golden, mid sized head. Fruity nose with some hay and pine needles. Mid sweet with medium body and clean, rounded mouthfeel. Resiny hay-like bitter finish. Somewhat unpolished and aggressive.
Clear and orange, nice white head. Grass and soap on the nose. Good bitter hops and refreshing body. A nice hoppy beer.

Keg at Pikkulintu. It pours clear gold with a thick white head. The nose is doughy, cereal, toasty grain, grass, cracker and grapefruit. The taste is crisp, clean, very bitter, grassy, doughy malt, soapy aspect, pepper and bitter grapefruit and cereal with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Great hopped-up lager bier.
8.3.2014. Cereal, grass and bitterness at nose. Taste has malts, citrus hops and proper bitters, not simultaneously but consecutively. Really a pils for my taste.
Tap at plevna, tampere. Little hazy light golden color, white head. Aroma is light malty, fruity and hoppy. Pure hoppy taste, fruity, grapefruit.
On tap at Stones Gastropub. Pours hazy gold with white head. Aroma is aromatic hops and malt. Flavour is medium to heavy bitter, pine and citrus. Delicious and heavy hopped.
Draught. Pours golden in color with a small head. Grassy bitterness, hay, notes of citrus and butter in aroma. Sweet honey, grassy meadow and nice maltyness in taste.

Aroma has grass, hops, malt. Taste is bitter, dry and has long hoppy aftertaste. Refreshing and nice pils.

Tap@ølhus helsinki. Golden clear. Pils clean malts, yeastyness on nose, some sharp citrus. Med light bodied, super bitter. Pale malts, yellow bitter berries. This is perplexing. It really does have that pils flavour, but is just soo bitter. If you would fatten it up., it would be more of an imperial lager. Right now its strange. Not bad, just very unbalanced.-- bb
Draught at Rotterdam. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with hops, grapefruit, pine, mango and resin. Bitter finish with grapefruit, hops, pine and resin. Excellent APA.
Clear golden with white head. Smell is bitter hops and bread. Taste is hoppy bitter and very dry. High bitterness and high carbonation.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Fruity, grass, hay, Nice pils. Refrehing Nice Beer.... Need more of it.- beerbasher

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Clear golden, thick lacing white head. Really fruity, mild diacetyl, honey, yeast. Flavor has grain, citrusy notes. Very malty, but crisp and tasty. Good. Bitter finish.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Golden yellow beer with smallish head. Aroma has butter, barley malts and grassy, citrus hops. Taste is grassy, bitter citrus and some malts to back the hops. A fresh and tasty pils for summer. Crispy carbonation and medium body. A brilliant pilsener.
Quite a nice body, with a golden hazy color. Not much of aroma, but the taste is really good. The finish comes quickly. Nice! Draft at SOPP 2014.
Smell of hop. Golden colour, white head. Aroma of malt and hop, some herbs. Finishes with grain. Bitter with a mild sourness. Light body. Very balanced.

Tap @ SOPP Helsinki 2014, 24/07/14. Pours an orange amber with a large, white head. Aroma is flowery, grassy, grainy. Taste is very dry with flower and grass, some citrus. Some grain. Sharp carbonation, but refreshingly light. An excellent quaffer.

Hana @ Leskinen. Kaatuu lasiin kullankeltaisena ja hieman sameana, niukka mutta pysyvä vaahto on tiivis ja mattomainen jättäen vahvaa pitsiä. Hajusta tuntuu kuin jenkkihumalat olisi sotkettu pilsiin: trooppista hedelmää, sitrusta, puuta ja viljaisuutta löytyy melko tasaisesti. Maussa jenkkivivahde jää hienosti taka-alalle. Hyvin viljaisen maltainen ja ruohoisen humalainen ensivaikutelma sitruksen, puumaisuuden sekä olkisuuden tukemana. Suutuntuma on todella katkeroinen, humalointi puree kyllä hyvin. Tuntuma on myös kuiva, raikas ja napakka. Hieno, todella hieno pils, joka on samalla kertaa raikas, katkera, kuiva, virkistävä ja monipuolinen. Mestariteos ja tyylinsä ehdotonta parhaimmistoa.

Draught @ Olutravintola Kukko. Golden beer, white head has small bubbles. Aroma is grassy hoppy, bready malty and citrus fruity. Flavour is very bitter with long aftertaste where bitterness stings your tongue. Bready malts, grassy hops, citrus. I like this very much and its a pity when this rotating tap changes to another beer.

Draught @ Pikkulintu

Pours clear orange with a smooth white head. Aroma of grassy hops, bready maltiness, some hints of butter and citrus. Taste is smooth, extremely hoppy and bitter with hints of grass, butter and sweetness. Finish is hoppy, grassy and lingering bitter with some sweet buttery notes and bready maltiness. Tasty stuff, at least for hopheads like myself. Quite extreme Czech pils. Nom.Earlier Rating: 11/20/2011 Total Score: 3.7Draught @ Pikkulintu, Helsinki

Pours light orange with a medium head. Aroma has notes of grassy hops and malts. Taste is very dry and bitter with notes of grass and fruits. Very bitter and dry finish. Nicely hopped and bitter pils.

Draught @ Pikkulintu
Aroma is rather light and sweaty with some fruity tones. Flavour has butter, so
me grassy notes and herbs. Feels quite czech. I used to like this more.Earlier Rating: 1/6/2012 Total Score: 3.7
Draught @ The brewpub, filtered version
Aroma is fruity with american hops. Some grass too. Flavour is rather hoppy with exotic fruits and grass. Some hay in the finish. Really hoppy pils.

Tap at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Sweetness, hops, grain and malts. Very hoppy and enjoyable pils. Earlier Rating: 10/13/2013 Total Score: 3.4Tap at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Originally rated 25112011. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Sweetness, grain, hops and malts.

Tap @ the brewpub.
Almost clear golden color, medium sized head. Nice bitter and fruity hops on the nose right off the bat, slight buttery notes with grass also. Grassy, a bit harsh bitter palate with orange and gooseberries on the flavor. Nice and definitely refreshing. Should be a regular.
3615Earlier Rating: 1/13/2013 Total Score: 3.8Draught.
Originally rated on 20090225.
Pours golden color with a medium head. Aroma of grassy hops, some buttery notes and fruits. Flavor of fruits, toffee, hay and butter. Nice.

Tap @ Plevna 
Slightly hazy golden orange beer with a huge white cloudy head leaving massive lacing on the glass. Aroma has grassy and citrusy hops, sweet malts and some buttery diacetyl. Taste is first malty, then citrusy and grassy hoppy until the massive bitterness on the finish kicks in. Its like chewing grapefruit peel. Mouthfeel is thicker than medium with quite heavy carbonation. A really heavily bitter beer - a bit simple but still enjoyable.

Draught @ the brewpub, Tampere. Pours a slightly hazy colour with a white head. Leaves nice lacing to the glass. Aroma is very rich with grassy hops and herbal notes. Flavour is very rich and extremely bitter with grains, mild citrus, butter and bread. Medium bodied, dry mouthfeel and a long, lingering bitter, dry finish. My kind of a beer. A bit better than I remembered.

This version is filtered and last time I had this (2011) it was filtered as well. The original Petolintu entry should be splitted to an unfiltered version and a filtered version, I think.Earlier Rating: 12/3/2011 Total Score: 3.6Draught @ Olutravintola Pikkulintu, Helsinki.
Pours a clear golden colour with some visible bubbles and a thick, white, very lacy head with good retention. Aroma of bitter hops, light honey and some malts. Flavour of grainy malts, very bitter grassy hops, honey and light toffee. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and a very bitter finish. Extremely hopped pils, very nice.
Tap at Plevna. Pours clear golden, white head. Grassy, butter, malts aroma. Bitter, grassy, buttery flavor. Dry.
Pale golden color with small head. Aroma is fruity, flavor is bitter hops and some malts. Dry finish.
Pours clear golden with a low head. Aroma is hops with some fruits. Flavor is malts with a very hoppy finish. Could use some more body, but otherwise good.

Draught. Very hazy yellow beer. Thick and creamy head is white. The aroma piney-resiny and slightly citrusy. Pale malts and a hint of toffy but the hops are dominating. Some nuttiness in the woody dry finish. Very bitter and lingering flavor is woody dry. Soft carbonation and smooth texture with powerful hop bite. Great beer with impressive bitteration. Top class drinkability.
Tap. Pours light clear golden with a nice head. Aroma rich in hops, some butter and grass. Taste bitter hops, somewhat dry palate. Not Bad.

Draught at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Golden, average and mostly lasting head. Light to moderate, malty and lightly sweetish aroma, light fruitiness some grassy - citrus hoppyness. Body is medium, malty and dryish flavor, faint fruitiness, grassy - citrus hoppyness. Finish is average to long, malty and dry, lots of grassy - citrus hoppyness. Really nice well hopped dry pils.

from old notes Billowy, lacy white head over a lightly cloudy, golden beer.  Sugary pilsner malts and light grains lead into spicy-earthy hops.  Firmly bitter against thin but sturdy malts with a lingering, almost cloying, hop aftertaste.  Creamy, light body with fine carbonation.

Reminiscent of Duvel at times; the bitterness lacks direction.

50 cl draft at Plevna.

Draught at Villi Wäino. Poured a golden, dull body with a big white head. Sweet grainy nose mixing with slightly soapy fruitiness. The taste is strange and strangely fine, eggy maltiness, bitter hopiness, hard to define, not that hard to enjoy.
Really nice balance.  Nice yeast haze.  Good body with solid, lasting bitterness.  A very solid Pilsener worth searching out.
Draught at Plevna. Nice white foam. Malty aroma and flowers (hop). Nice maltiness with a lasting bitterness that compliment a firm body with some residual sweetness.

Known as "Pedolintu" among the Finnish beer connoisseurs. A bit hazy orange, steady white head, lots of lace. Very German - grassy, hayish aroma. Flavor is typical German too: very hayish hoppy. Finish is nicely grassy bitter with long aftertaste. The most German of all Plevna beers (although hops are Perle and Goldings). Solid, but doesnt impress me with its one dimensional character.

On tap at Olutravintola Pikkulintu, Helsinki. 
Cool to be the first non-fin to rate this one, unfortunately i didnt like it.
It pours hazy golden, with a medium white head. 
The aroma is (Im sorry) pissoir, making it very hard to drink.
The flavor is fine though - dry citrus, hops, fruit and with hints of pine. Firmly bitter.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Helsinki. Hazy golden colour, small white head. Aroma is hops, grass, some yeast and also mildly bready. Flavour is wood, yeast, mild notes of earth and also some lemon/citrusy fruits. A rather interesting and nice pils.

Draught @ Plevna, Tampere.  Light golden color, little bit cloudy. White soapy head. Aroma has soft hops aroma with lemon. Flavor on the other hand is nothing but soft. Lovely dry and bitter with stunning hops. Honest pilsener.. must be my first finnish pilsener which actually tastes likes one.

Draught at Pikkulintu 12.10.2008. Pale head. Cloudy pale golden yellow colour. Soft taste at beginning. Some grapefruit and maltiness in the taste. Fruity grassy taste. Mild hoppiness with some hints of orange in the nose. Aso some hints of apricose in the taste.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2014 Draught (500 ml) at Plevna, Tampere, Finland. 
Hazy golden colour with frothy creamy head. Long lasting hoppy aftertaste. Good pils.

Draught at the Plevna, Tampere, Finland.
Cloudy golden colour with a big foamy white head,
Strong grassy hoppy aroma with mild balancing maltiness. Balanced it seems to be. The flavour is really strong bitter hoppy. Its not just the grassy hoppiness but also grapefruit and resiny bitterness. Really bitter for a Pilsener. Its tasty but I cant say its balanced.

Fraught at Pikkulintu. Looks like a Weißbier with its hazy yellow color and massive head. Aroma instantly reminds me of Germany. Flavor is dominated by fruity hops. A great beer by Plevna - good work!

Draught at Sadonkorjuu 2008, Porvoo. Yellow color. Malty honeyish aroma with notes of apricot. The aroma is surprisingly weak and low on hops. Bittersweet flavor with strong herbal and grapefruity hop taste. The hop presence is strong but somewhat coarse, grassy and vegetal.

keg at Pikkulintu ,33l 3,5 09.10.08 bit hazy golden yellow lacing creamy white head Taste: tangy grapefruit crispy hops strong long lasting bitter aftertaste. Remind me about Mikkeller Draft Beer. This kind of pilsener I prefer.

Golden colored with slight cloudyness. Little yellow head. Floral-hopped and nicely fruity aroma. Medium bodied, crispy palate. Flavor is more hopped and not so soft-flowery with biting hops and lemon, aftertaste lasts long with strong bitterness. One could say that excellent hoppy pils, one that not so balanced one. I think I’m in between. Excellent aroma anyhow.

Draught @ Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Slightly cloudy golden color, rocky white head. Slight malty aroma with some hoppy notes, kind of a disappointment. Very bitter flavor with fresh malts in the background and some notes of grapefruit and cigars, dry finish. Far too bitter for my taste, but a well-crafted beer nonetheless.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2010 Keg (Pikkulintu, Helsinki) - Happy birthday Pikkulintu!
Slightly hazy gold. Healthy creamy head. Sweet creamy malty aroma, subtly hopped - crisp and fruity. Typical Plevna creamy malty body. Richly flavoured - big hoppy taste - dry and bitter, and staying for a long finish. But also sweet and malty. Very pleasant, one of the better lagers Ive had.
WARNING - dont touch the filtered version, its shit compared to the unfiltered version.

(Draught at Pikkulintu on 2008-10-09) Golden. Hazy. Medium sized quite dense white head. Grassy and fruity nose. Medium bodied dryish palate with lot of carbonation. Grass, bitterness, fruitiness and bit of sweetness in taste. Long bitter and still quite soft aftertaste.
(draught@pikkulintu) golden clean color. Very hoppy. Best (and hoppiest?) pils in world

(Draught@Pikkulintu, Helsinki) Hazy golden with a medium, creamy and lacy head. Very crisp and lemony aroma with fruity and pale-malty notes. Very bitter and crisp flavor with lemony-grassy, aromatic hoppiness, but also a reasonably malty base keeping it all in balance. Long, bitter and grassy aftertaste. Light to medium-bodied, crisp and refreshing palate with medium carbonation. Clean, crisp, balanced, bitter and refreshing. A great pils!
